item.title: Palabra del día: ‘succor’
item.description: Esta palabra ha aparecido en 23 artículos en NYTimes.com en el último año. ¿Puedes usarla en una frase?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: Word of the Day: succor
item.description: This word has appeared in 23 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year. Can you use it in a sentence?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: Teen Recounts Escape from Deadly Swiss Fire
item.description: People gathered at memorials in the resort town of Crans-Montana, Switzerland, to grieve for the victims of a deadly New Year’s fire at a bar. A survivor described her harrowing escape.
item.dc:creator: Shawn Paik

media:content.media:credit: Til Bürgy for The New York Times

item.title: Mamdani Revokes Executive Orders That Adams Signed to Support Israel
item.description: Former Mayor Eric Adams and some conservative-leaning Jewish leaders criticized the revocation of his executive orders, one of which he signed just last month.
item.dc:creator: Liam Stack

media:content.media:credit: Dave Sanders for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Mayor Zohran Mamdani took office on Thursday.

item.title: A Marine Corps Pilot and a Netflix Producer. Who’d Have Guessed?
item.description: Ginger Cutler and Tom Glinkowski had very different jobs and very different opinions on cats.
item.dc:creator: Jenny Block

item.title: They Met on a Summer Vacation That Never Ended
item.description: Rachel Leiner was reading at a cafe in Lisbon when she was invited to join a group of strangers, Jurgen Peeters among them.
item.dc:creator: Stella Raine Chu

item.title: She Passed the Audition — and Later Won His Heart
item.description: Lara Russell-Lasalandra met Umang Chaudhry at an audition for an a cappella ensemble. He was on the leadership committee.
item.dc:creator: Shivani Vora

item.title: My Mother’s Last, Best Gift Was an Astonishing Secret
item.description: It took my mother getting Alzheimer’s for my siblings and me to learn the truth about our family and childhood.
item.dc:creator: Brett Paesel

media:content.media:credit: Brian Rea

item.title: Rushing to Her Father’s Hospital Bedside, with a Wedding in Tow
item.description: Arianna Lacerte grew up around the Boston Celtics because of her dad’s job. But it wasn’t just a mutual love of sports that attracted Josh Kipnis — it was their shared love of family.
item.dc:creator: Tammy LaGorce

item.title: In China, A.I. Finds Pancreatic Cancer That Doctors May Miss
item.description: A tool for spotting pancreatic cancer in routine CT scans has had promising results, one example of how China is racing to apply A.I. to medicine’s tough problems.
item.dc:creator: Vivian Wang and Andrea Verdelli

media:content.media:description: Self-service kiosks at the Affiliated People’s Hospital of Ningbo University. The hospital, in Ningbo, China, is testing an A.I.-powered tool for detecting pancreatic cancer.

item.title: Can the Most Indebted Team in Global Soccer Fix Its Finances?
item.description: F.C. Barcelona’s liabilities have reached 2.5 billion euros, the result of financial mismanagement and vaulting ambition.
item.dc:creator: Tariq Panja

media:content.media:credit: David Ramos/Getty Images
media:content.media:description: The Camp Nou stadium in Barcelona, Spain, reopened in November. b, which is mostly related to a stadium refurbishment.

item.title: Quote of the Day: ‘Zero Hour’ in Middle East As War-Weariness Sets In
item.description: Quotation of the Day for Friday, January 2, 2026.

item.title: NYT Crossword Hints for Jan. 2, 2026
item.description: Adam Wagner and Rafael Musa’s puzzle is a lovely parting gift for this columnist.
item.dc:creator: Deb Amlen

media:content.media:credit: Phil Walter -- Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Billie Jean is ... not an answer in this puzzle.

item.title: Search Is Suspended for Passenger Who Went Overboard From Cruise Ship
item.description: The U.S. Coast Guard said on Thursday that it halted its hourslong search for a 77-year-old woman who went overboard from a Holland America Line cruise ship near Cuba.
item.dc:creator: Johnny Diaz

media:content.media:credit: Finnbarr Webster/Getty Images
media:content.media:description: The Holland America Line cruise ship Nieuw Statendam in Portland, in southwest England, in 2024. A 77-year-old woman went overboard from the ship as it was cruising near Cuba on Thursday.

item.title: ‘I Will Govern as a Democratic Socialist,’ Mamdani Says at Inauguration
item.description: Mayor Zohran Mamdani was inaugurated as the mayor of New York City on Thursday in a ceremony attended by thousands outside City Hall. Flanked by progressive stars of the Democratic Party, he told New Yorkers his administration would “govern without shame and insecurity, making no apology for what we believe.”
item.dc:creator: Mimi Dwyer, Meg Felling and Michael Anthony Adams

media:content.media:credit: Amir Hamja for The New York Times

item.title: Amid Poetry, Song and the Cold, Mamdani’s Inauguration Evokes Hope
item.description: A communal spectacle, spilling out of City Hall into the streets of Broadway, conveyed how many New Yorkers see the promise in a Zohran Mamdani mayoralty.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Fandos

media:content.media:credit: Hiroko Masuike/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The crowd that filled a stretch of Broadway, south of City Hall in Manhattan, spanned a cross-section of the city’s residents.

item.title: Mamdani Lays Out Agenda of ‘Affordability and Abundance’ on First Day in Office
item.description: Mayor Zohran Mamdani acknowledged skeptics of his plans while reiterating that he would focus on working-class New Yorkers.
item.dc:creator: Jeffery C. Mays and Emma G. Fitzsimmons

media:content.media:credit: James Estrin/ The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Zohran Mamdani, standing with his wife, Rama Duwaji, waves to the crowd outside City Hall at his inauguration ceremony.

item.title: Mamdani’s First Orders Focus on Housing and Undoing Adams’s Decisions
item.description: Mayor Zohran Mamdani signed a flurry of executive orders on his first day as mayor of New York City. They were aimed at protecting tenants and revoking some of ex-Mayor Eric Adams’s past orders.
item.dc:creator: Emma G. Fitzsimmons and Emma Goldberg

media:content.media:credit: Dave Sanders for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Mayor Zohran Mamdani signed a series of executive orders to protect tenants at a rent stabilized building in Flatbush, Brooklyn, on Thursday.

item.title: Incendio de Año Nuevo en Suiza: esto es lo que se sabe
item.description: El fuego en un bar de una popular estación de esquí mató a unas 40 personas e hirió a más de 100, dijeron las autoridades. La causa aún se desconoce.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Wolfe

media:content.media:credit: Alessandro Della Valle/Keystone, vía Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Decenas de personas murieron y más de 100 resultaron heridas tras registrarse un incendio en Le Constellation, un bar de Crans-Montana, en el cantón suizo de Valais, según las autoridades.

item.title: Images From the Dawn of the Mamdani Era
item.description: Thousands of New Yorkers packed the plaza ouside City Hall and the streets of Lower Manhattan to see Mayor Zohran Mamdani take office.
item.dc:creator: Tim Balk

media:content.media:credit: Amir Hamja for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Thousands of people gathered outside City Hall to see Mayor Zohran Mamdani and his wife, Rama Duwaji, at Mr. Mamdani’s inauguration on Thursday.

item.title: Witnesses Recount Fire That Killed 40 in Switzerland
item.description: It was a haven for the young, where they could find hot chocolate when they wanted quiet and affordable drinks when they did not. Then it turned into a place of death.
item.dc:creator: Ségolène Le Stradic and Til Bürgy

media:content.media:description: Mourners gathered on Thursday evening near Le Constellation in the resort village of Crans-Montana, Switzerland.

item.title: Mamdani Pays Tribute to the Foods That Define and Sustain New York
item.description: In his inaugural address, Mayor Zohran Mamdani invoked the cuisines of New York as metaphors for the city’s diversity, ambitions and promise.
item.dc:creator: Andy Newman

media:content.media:credit: Amir Hamja for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Zohran Mamdani dug into the chicken biryani last year at Kabab King in Jackson Heights, Queens, a restaurant he has frequented since high school.

item.title: Venezuela libera a decenas de presos políticos
item.description: Al menos 80 personas fueron excarceladas, entre ellas una con vínculos con Estados Unidos. Más de 800 personas siguen detenidas por oponerse al gobierno de Nicolás Maduro, dicen ONG.
item.dc:creator: Anatoly Kurmanaev and Annie Correal

media:content.media:credit: Alejandro Cegarra para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Un grupo de mujeres sostiene pañuelos con los nombres de presos políticos en Caracas, en noviembre.

item.title: Rusia pide a EE. UU. que detenga la persecución de un petrolero en fuga
item.description: El barco, que navegaba hacia Venezuela para recoger petróleo, ha reclamado protección rusa, aunque las autoridades estadounidenses afirman que se trata de un buque apátrida.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Nehamas, Edward Wong and Tyler Pager

media:content.media:credit: Eva Marie Uzcategui/Reuters
media:content.media:description: Un helicóptero de la Guardia Costera estadounidense volaba en Puerto Rico el mes pasado.

item.title: Mamdani Vows to Govern ‘Audaciously’ and Protect New York’s Vulnerable
item.description: Zohran Mamdani gave his first public speech as mayor of New York City, after an inauguration that drew tens of thousands of people.
item.dc:creator: Dana Rubinstein

media:content.media:credit: Amir Hamja for The New York Times

item.title: Art Gallery Shows to See in January
item.description: This week in Newly Reviewed, Will Heinrich covers Jana Euler’s delightful absurdity, Lotty Rosenfeld’s portraits of the Pinochet dictatorship and Erich Heckel’s eerie dream world.
item.dc:creator: Will Heinrich
item.category: Wallach, Miriam and Ira D, Art Gallery

item.title: ‘You Are Worth It’: Jumaane Williams Delivers Powerful Inauguration Speech
item.description: Mr. Williams, New York City’s public advocate, teared up as he addressed a portion of his remarks to his younger self, captivating the crowd.
item.dc:creator: Maya King and Talya Minsberg

media:content.media:credit: Vincent Alban/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Jumaane Williams has entered his third term as New York’s public advocate, who serves as a watchdog for city government.

item.title: Las mejores películas de 2025, según los lectores del Times
item.description: Les pedimos que votaran por las mejores cintas del año, y el resultado fue una mezcla de grandes éxitos de taquilla y joyas del cine independiente.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Goodman

item.description: Plus, tips from our readers on how to stay informed without feeling overwhelmed in 2026.

item.title: The Full Transcript of Zohran Mamdani’s Inauguration Speech
item.description: New York’s new mayor challenged his supporters and his opponents to make the city better, and to hold him to account.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times

media:content.media:credit: Amir Hamja for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: “What we achieve together will reach across the five boroughs and it will resonate far beyond,” Mayor Zohran Mamdani told New Yorkers in his inaugural address.

item.title: Fire in Swiss Alps Leaves Dozens of New Year’s Revelers Dead
item.description: About 40 people celebrating at a ski resort bar were killed, and 115 were injured, many of them young, the authorities said.
item.dc:creator: Ségolène Le Stradic, Christopher F. Schuetze, Aurelien Breeden and Richard Pérez-Peña

media:content.media:credit: Til Bürgy for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: An officer near a bar in Crans-Montana, Switzerland, where a deadly fire broke out during a New Year’s celebration early Thursday.

item.title: New York Magazine Put Mamdani’s Team on Its Cover. One Aide Was Erased.
item.description: Catherine Almonte Da Costa was part of a photo shoot on the mayor-elect’s inner circle. The next day she resigned amid an uproar over antisemitic statements she had posted on social media years earlier.
item.dc:creator: Katherine Rosman

media:content.media:credit: Sara Naomi Lewkowicz for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The latest cover of New York magazine includes a group portrait of Zohran Mamdani and his inner circle. Catherine Almonte Da Costa had stood in the space where the “W” in the magazine logo can now be seen.

item.title: Tiny Love Stories: ‘Am I Too Old to Experience Butterflies?’
item.description: Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.

media:content.media:credit: Brian Rea

item.title: Rama Duwaji Gives ‘Statement Coat’ New Meaning at Mamdani’s Inauguration
item.description: With her chocolate-brown princess-line coat, New York’s new first lady looked a little funky, a little vintage, a little Tolstoy, entirely proper and unlike anyone else on the stage.
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman

media:content.media:credit: Amir Hamja for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Rama Duwaji arriving with her husband, Mayor Zohran Mamdani, for his official inauguration ceremony at City Hall on Thursday.

item.title: Venezuela Frees Dozens of Political Prisoners
item.description: At least 80 people were released, including one with U.S. ties, though more than 800 remain detained in Venezuela for opposing President Nicolás Maduro’s rule, rights groups say.
item.dc:creator: Anatoly Kurmanaev and Annie Correal

media:content.media:credit: Alejandro Cegarra for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A group of women holding handkerchiefs with the names of political prisoners in Caracas in November.

item.title: Janet Fish, Painter of Luminous Still Lifes, Dies at 87
item.description: From her student days, she stubbornly refused to follow popular artistic trends. Instead, she spent decades exploring the effects of light on glass.
item.dc:creator: Michael S. Rosenwald

media:content.media:credit: via DC Moore Gallery
media:content.media:description: “Bird’s Nest/Apple Blossoms” (2004).

item.title: Here’s Why Lucy Dacus Chose ‘Bread and Roses’ for Mamdani’s Inauguration
item.description: The Grammy-winning singer, part of the supergroup boygenius, followed a performance by Mandy Patinkin, who sang “Over the Rainbow.”
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Abrams

media:content.media:credit: Amir Hamja for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Lucy Dacus during a concert in Queens last year.

item.title: AOC Urges New Yorkers to Celebrate Mamdani’s Inauguration as Their Own
item.description: Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, speaking at Zohran Mamdani’s inauguration, said that his election represented New Yorkers’ choosing “prosperity for the many over spoils for the few.”
item.dc:creator: Talya Minsberg

item.title: This Diminutive Reptile Plays Rock-Paper-Scissors
item.description: Side-blotched lizards probably don’t call the game that, but they play a version of it anyway. A new study explains the hidden biology that makes this possible.
item.dc:creator: Carl Zimmer

item.title: Swiss Alps Ski Resort Fire: What We Know
item.description: The fire at a bar in a popular ski resort killed around 40 people and injured more than 100, officials said. The cause was still unknown.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Wolfe

media:content.media:credit: Til Bürgy for The New York Times

item.title: Iran Protests Turn Deadly as Violence and Anger Spread
item.description: Financial pressures have fueled a fifth day of demonstrations around Iran, with at least one person killed in the protests so far, according to the authorities.
item.dc:creator: Ben Hubbard, Sanam Mahoozi and Leily Nikounazar

media:content.media:credit: Majid Asgaripour/Wana News Agency, via Reuters
media:content.media:description: A photo released by Iranian state media showed shops closed in Tehran’s Grand Bazaar on Tuesday, following protests over a currency crisis.

item.title: Russia Asks United States to Stop Pursuit of Fleeing Oil Tanker
item.description: The tanker, which had been sailing to Venezuela to pick up oil, has claimed Russian protection, although the U.S. authorities say it is a stateless vessel.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Nehamas, Edward Wong and Tyler Pager

media:content.media:credit: Eva Marie Uzcategui/Reuters
media:content.media:description: A U.S. Coast Guard helicopter flying in Puerto Rico last month.

media:content.media:credit: Michael Adams for The New York Times

item.title: A Vegetarian Cooking Resolution Starter Pack
item.description: This simple and reliable collection of vegetarian staples — beans, pasta, tofu, salads and soups — will help you cook confidently all year long.
item.dc:creator: Tanya Sichynsky

media:content.media:credit: Nico Schinco for The New York Times. Food Stylist: Kaitlin Wayne.
media:content.media:description: Hetty Lui McKinnon’s soy sauce and brown butter brussels sprouts pasta.

item.title: A DJ, a Poet and Politicians Make Up Mamdani’s Inaugural Lineup
item.description: Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez will deliver opening remarks and Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont will administer the oath of office.
item.dc:creator: Talya Minsberg

media:content.media:credit: Shuran Huang for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, Democrat of New York, will deliver the opening remarks at Zohran Mamdani’s ceremonial inauguration on Thursday.

item.title: Mayor Zohran Mamdani, at Inauguration, Vows to Represent All New Yorkers
item.description: Mr. Mamdani, the city’s first Muslim and South Asian mayor, celebrated the city’s diversity and pledged to govern “audaciously” in his inaugural address. Hours later, he signed three executive orders related to housing.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times

media:content.media:credit: Amir Hamja for The New York Times

item.title: Dozens Confirmed Dead in Fire at New Year’s Party in Swiss Alps
item.description: The local police said that their preliminary toll was about 40 dead, with roughly 115 injured, in the early morning blaze at a bar in the resort town of Crans-Montana.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times

media:content.media:credit: Til Bürgy for The New York Times
